name: market for inert filler | inert filler | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9194/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for 'inert filler', in the the Global geography. This is a generic market; the suppliers of this market make available this generic product by redirecting a part of the production of several more specific products.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;The product "inert filler" represents sand. It is used for cement production. The main groups of fine-grained mineral solids used as admixtures are powdered unreactive rock, such as limestone or quartz, which are either natural or industrial by-products. Unreactive rock material is an inert filler that can improve the workability of the fresh concrete, especially when the available aggregate lack fines.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'inert filler',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'inert filler',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Of the total road transport, 6% is assumed to be by delivery van for goods with a large share of retail sale, and 3% for goods that are mainly sold via wholesale.
